author: AceKiron
content: We can tell who our owners are! We know if they're here or not!

author: AceKiron
content: We all have our own personalities!

author: AceKiron
content: We love people!

author: AceKiron
content: Don't touch us too often! You could damage our slime coat and it may hurt.

author: AceKiron
content: We are near extinct. Raise some of your own axolotls with proper care to help us!

author: AceKiron
content: Axolotls have 4 fingers, but 5 toes.

author: AceKiron
content: We don't have eyelids, so make sure to put hides for us to rest our little eyes.

author: AceKiron
content: We are carnivorous, so the best diet for us are dendrobaena worms or night crawlers.

author: AceKiron
content: We live in cold water, ideally between 16째C - 18째C. That's 60.8째F - 64.4째F if you're American.

author: AceKiron
content: We are nocturnal! If you see us not doing much during the day, that's normal.

author: AceKiron
content: Blood worms are a good snack for us, but only as snacks because they don't have nutrients.

author: AceKiron
content: Never take us out of the water as we're fully aquatic!

author: AceKiron
content: We are native to only Lake Xochimilco.

author: AceKiron
content: We have amazing regenerative abilities, we can regenerate almost any part of our body, including parts of our heart and parts of our brain.

author: AceKiron
content: We have both gills and lungs, but don't take us out of the water.

author: AceKiron
content: Our species is named after the Aztec god Xolotl.

author: AceKiron
content: We're very resistant to cancer.

author: AceKiron
content: Scientists are studying us in the hopes to make humans regenerate lost limbs.

author: AceKiron
content: It doesn't hurt when we accidentally bite you.

author: AceKiron
content: We absolutely love begging our owners for food when we see them.

author: AceKiron
content: We're great pets, but not easy to take care of.

author: AceKiron
content: Water flow shouldn't be too strong, it stresses us out.

author: AceKiron
content: You can tell if we are stressed by looking at how curved forward our gills are, a hooked tail is also a sign of stress.

author: AceKiron
content: We have poor eyesight, so we often mistake things for food.

author: AceKiron
content: We're opportunistic hunters.

author: AceKiron
content: Make sure you can take care of us before actually buying your own axolotl.

author: AceKiron
content: Bare bottom or fine sand only, no gravel! We will eat everything that fits in our mouth, including gravel.

author: AceKiron
content: Wild axolotls are rarely white or pink.

author: AceKiron
content: We exhibit Neoteny.

author: AceKiron
content: We eat by using suction, not by chewing our food.

author: AceKiron
content: Axolotls have very few predators.

author: AceKiron
content: The males often grow longer than the females, but not always.

author: AceKiron
content: Our breeding season typically runs from March to June.

author: AceKiron
content: Researchers are encouraging axolotls to breed by building 'shelters' in Xochimilco.
